key_events.description: Vale's iron ore production reached 90.4 million tons in 4Q25, a 6% increase compared to 4Q24. Total production in 2025 reached 336.1 million tons, a 2.6% increase compared to 2024.
Sales totaled 84.9 million tons in 4Q25, a 4.5% increase year-over-year. The average realized price of iron ore fines was US$ 95.4 per ton.

Copper production totaled 108.1 thousand tons in 4Q25, a 6.2% increase year-over-year. Annual copper production reached 382.4kt, exceeding the guidance top of 270kt. Nickel production reached 46.2 thousand tons in 4Q25, a 1.5% increase year-over-year.
Vale invested approximately $480 million USD in a project that will add nearly 15,000 tons of production capacity, bringing the total nominal capacity to 40,000 tons.

Six out of eight recommendations indicate 'buy' for Vale, and two classify the stock as 'hold'. Santander and Agora estimate a further valuation of 10% by the end of 2026, with a price target for Vale's ADR in New York at US$ 15.50 (Santander) and the paper in Brazil at R$ 83 (Ágora).
Vale Day 2025 took place on November 25, 2025.
Vale will release its Production and Sales Report for 4Q25 on January 27, 2026.
Vale will hold a results teleconference with a webcast on February 13, 2026, at 11:00 AM Brasília time.
Vale expects commitments of US$ 1.8 billion in 2026 and US$ 2.8 billion from 2027 onwards related to Mariana and Brumadinho.

investment_thesis.bull_case: Vale's iron ore, copper, and nickel production are increasing, with copper production exceeding guidance. Analyst ratings are mostly positive, with price targets indicating further valuation.
investment_thesis.bear_case: UBS BB believes that Vale's operational improvement is already priced in. Vale faces commitments of US$ 1.8 billion in 2026 and US$ 2.8 billion from 2027 onwards related to Mariana and Brumadinho.
